snippet.title: Below Kryll Gameplay - Ectoplasm Escapades
snippet.description:
This is my playthrough of my own stage in the online game Below Kryll. The ultimate goal of a stage is to reach the 'shrine' at the end, but players also must collect anywhere from 1 - 5 shurikens in order to 'perfect' the stage. In this video I show off how to get a 'perfect' on my stage, though I certainly die a good amount.

Below Kryll is a recently-released indie game which is almost entirely community-driven as the world consists of a giant grid where players can claim tiles to turn into stages. While there is no direct multiplayer outside of chat, the very nature of the game means players will determine how the world interconnects and will be constantly interacting with the creations of others.

On a final note, an account for Below Kryll currently costs $9.99 (and is definitely worth it in my opinion), but it is also possible to create a trial account, which grants access to a very generous amount of content. Fans of the Knytt games, Little Big Planet, action platformers, and/or metroidvanias in particular should probably at least give this game a shot.

Below Kryll can be found here: https://game.belowkryll.com/web/blog/
The Greenlight page can be found here: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=197415097

On an unrelated note, this is my first video in a while due to being rather busy, but I should go back to releasing videos more frequently in the very near future.
